Hey guys, has anyone here had experience in migrating big projects from Eclipse to Android Studio?

I'm just looking for tips on how to go about it. The import in Android Studio does not work very well. I have a written down a longer description of where I'm at right now but I didn't want to immediately post it here
<@U0EQ6UWUQ>: thanks, thought it might be a mobile restriction, yet even with headers changed and spoofed agents it doesn’t work  on the phone
now I gotta use their api, aaaah
I’m trying with this but I have only 1 activity everything is a fragment
<@U06CMRAC9> migrated like 3 projects, there is no easy way. manually updating dependencie, deleting old ones, cleaning, rebuilding and gradle syncing is mostly what you’ll have to do all the time
tbh the easiest way is to create a new project, add dependencies and move over all classes manually
doesn’t AS have some feature to import from eclipse
it sucked the last time I tried it
ah should have read the other message
like really sucked
:smile:
when I was doing it I did it manually as well
+1 for what <@U0548MM6B> said, first make the gradle dependencies and then copy-paste classes and files. Make sure to put resource files in the resource folder and set that up as well
<@U0HQYPUP2>: getWindow().setStatusBarColor?
<@U0548MM6B>: It’s only change the background, not the icon and texts color
oooh skipped that
I think I need to change the activity theme
with the windowLightStatusbar style field
but that way I have to re-apply the theme to the activity
yeah I did it like 3 times, maybe even four, all huge projects
no easy way to migrate
and I only have 1 activity and everything is a fragment so I have no idea how to reload the theme in runtime
you can't change a theme at runtime
yeah, I know
:S

Hey guys. I’m currently trying to integrate the Pinterest SDK. I got everything working up until the point of authentication. When I have the pinterest app installed, authenticatin works fine but when i dont have the pinterest app installed and am doing authentication via the webview, after successfull credentials, the callback is not fired, im only getting back to my app.
I don’t know what im doing wrong here as the SDK should handle this process right?
no matter if i have pinterest installed or not
The only thing im getting in logcat when coming back from the webview is this: E/PDK: com.pinterest
got a link to sdk docs maybe?
yeah sure
wait
<https://developers.pinterest.com/docs/sdks/android/>
But I’m not doing any calls to either the Pinterest App or the WebView, just doing pdkClient.login()
the sdk should take care of the rest
like facebook sdk and so on
yeah I’m looking at the sample code and it seems pretty clear
intent filter all set up in manifest with your key?
<https://github.com/Pinterest/Android-PDK/blob/master/app%2Fsrc%2Fmain%2FAndroidManifest.xml>
yep
yeah makes no sense then why it wouldn’t return
try looking at the sdk source, maybe you find something
if i did something wrong the authentication over pinterest app wouldnt work either, right? ˆˆ
it would, since they use startActivityForResult for that ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
you sure your client ID is proper and manifest is proper? that is the only thing I can think of by looking over it
triple checked it
tried running their sample app?
just did
there is works fine
maybe it has to do with from where i start the login process
i”m starting it after a dialogfragment
nah if right activities are in play
idk what to tell you, cuz I gotta write the shitty google location boilerplate now
/gif boilerplate
react == boilerplate
So I suppose I'm stuck migrating everything manually for the most part?
Ill post what I wrote up earlier

I have a pretty big project that I'm slowly working on migrating to Android Studio. It has multiple android library sub projects as dependencies, and they all vary on minsdkversion, compilesdkversion and targetsdkversion, some also seem to use different versions of the android support libraries and possibly google play services. Since it works so much differently than Eclipse the automatic import does not work at all. I get tons of xml errors, such as resources already being defined, not being able to find certain resources, and just tons of dependencies not being resolved. Also a lot of sdk level errors. 


I've figured out a few things about it. Like the duplicate attributes were due to the import process using the latest version of google pay services, which uses appcompat, which conflicts with sherlock. It seems that every time I fix some errors or problems, even more pop up. Any tips on making this process less painful? I've used some Eclipse for android development before, but not nearly enough to know how to fix these problems quickly.
having sherlock as a dependency means codebase is pretty old
do you intend to do further development on it?
Yeah, I was given the project. Its not my code and right now Im just trying to make it work on android studio
Once I get it running Ill work on just updating everything and keeping it modern
mhm
Its kind of a headache switching it over haha
yes I know… regarding play services you can set up a resolution strategy to force update pretty much everything
you can also unify the minsdk version to something sensible
I’d say 16 or something
Yeah I think that's where I will start. There's some that go down as far as 4 lol
yeah I imagine :simple_smile:
for sherlock I have no clue - haven’t used in with AS at all
My problem with play services is that if I use the latest version, it conflicts with sherlock :confused:
and imagine it could be very painful
yeah, unify min SDK first, update libraries, update services
<@U06CMRAC9>: are you overhauling the facebook app? :stuck_out_tongue:
didn’t use sherlock in a long time also :confused:
hahahah
hahahah
